intro: Mesembryanthemum altigena, commonly known as the Canary Island rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and coastal environments. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mesembryanthemum altigena is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
